name: Carlton Arms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked this hotel online with great anticipation. It was described as a kind of cheap and cheerful place with a good location. Upon arrival we were given 3 keys to 3 rooms for us to choose from. The first two were run down and grotty. The third, the best of the three which we chose was not great either. There was an offensive smell of cat urine in the hall outside our room. There was a brown stain on the bed and bleech stains on the towels. There was no hot water and the pressure of the shower was non existant. The bedding comprised of one sheet when it was 6 degrees outside. This hotel was not for us and we ended up finding alternative accomodation for our weeks stay in Manhattan. I wouldn't say that the location was fantastic although it was OK. I would not recomend this hotel to any couples who are after a romantic holiday. This hotel would suit students who are used to living in unclean poor accomodation. The safety of the hotel is also suspect. On arrival we were given a pad lock to put on our door when were left the hotl. This did not give us any confidence in the secrurity of the hotel The overall opinion of this hotel is... you get what you pay for - very little!!!
reviews.title: Not For Us!
Carlton Arms Hotel NY. Funky Cheap & Cheerful
reviews.text: Let me first off say I can imagine this place isn't going to be for everyone. If you like your little luxuries then I don't think this is for you. If you've not got a good sense of adventure, then, again - this may not be for you. On the other hand, if you're looking for somewhere cheap to put your head down for the night, clean, & pretty close to the sights, then consider this.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a room with private bathroom (most rooms don't have a private bathroom). We had room 1D. It was quite a hike up the stairs with the bags. The decor is crazy (like the whole hotel) but that is its charm. Mind the stairs cos they are a bit worn away. The room isn't huge but I did a lot of research before booking and realised that there doesn't seem to be any such thing as a big room for a budget price.
reviews.title: we've stayed there 3 times..

likes.disliked: — a bit noisy, beds not so comfy

reviews.title: Expensive weekend in NYC
reviews.text: Our room faced East 25th Street. I understand this was quieter then being on 3rd Avenue. It didn't really matter because we were that tired from sight seeing every night I'd of slept through anything.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Closet space is a little limited but I guess most people, like us, will only be doing a short break, so it didn't matter too much.
reviews.title: Not bad for the price

likes.disliked: — The smell of smoke on our floor and the rusty sink

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from a trip around the US and stayed a few nights at this "hotel". Billed as arty but sparse it certainly fits the bill. For those that appreciate art it may be worth a visit but as for having somewhere to actually stay I'd pick somewhere else.
reviews.title: Colorful and crap

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All you get for your $110 a night is a room with a bed and a sink (in our case a rather rusty sink). With it being an arty hotel there's plenty of arty artefacts in the room which never seem to get cleaned and are full of dust everywhere. The bedding and towels provided had stains on them. The shared bathrooms (15 rooms & 1 bathroom per floor) seem to get cleaned only once a day, and the rooms never get cleaned during your stay. There's no room service, no other facilities and not even a TV.
reviews.title: perfect hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All this with the excuse that it's cheap and your in NY afterall! Which apparently means you can skip on facilities normally associated with a hotel and still charge more..
reviews.title: "Not Worh It"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: To top it all, during one of our nights they decided to switch on the heating during the night, which made the radiator in our room burst out into such an loud array of noises that we both woke up and couldn't get back to sleep, which is really the only thing you are supposed to be able to do in this place
reviews.title: Value, Value, Value!

reviews.text: If this was billed as a hostel it may be more acceptable. The location may be good but The Carlton Arms really didn't add to our enjoyment of New York. As it stands, if you want to enjoy New York on a budget, you're probably better of at a real hostel, such as the Big Apple
reviews.title: Looking for "nice"?

likes.disliked: — Some of the rooms are a bit over-the-top. Choose wisely.

reviews.text: My best friend and I stayed at this hotel/hostel the weekend of the NYC Marathon when we were desperately seeking affordable accommodations for a last minute trip. You certainly can't beat the price for the location, but it certainly takes an open mind to stay there. As young professionals who have travelled the world, we just took it all in stride and had a good laugh at ourselves as we made ourselves comfy in our "Good vs Evil" room. The stairs were a bit of a workout each day, especially with luggage, and I certainly wouldn't want to spend a romantic weekend here, but my girlfriend and I spent 3 nights here and have no complaints. I do recommend flip flops for the showers and such, but it was clean and bug free and definitely a place to remember! (I found the hotel in the Fodor's guide and certainly think their review was pretty accurate!)
reviews.title: Definitely an Adventure, but a fun memory!

reviews.text: In May, two of my friends and I decided to take a week- long trip to New York City. We're college students from Alaska and were ready for a very uncomfortable and unfamiliar experience. The Carlton Arms contradicted any fears we could have possibly had about staying in such an unfamiliar place. When I called to make a reservation, a friendly British guy gave us all of the help we needed. Confirming the reservation was also a breeze. When we finally found the hotel ( you can't tell its a hotel from the outside), the nice guy in the office gave us a few different room keys and let us choose which room we liked best. the building is an old one so there is no elevator which sometimes made going back to the room a pain after a long day of walking in the heat but we're young and lived through it easily. the art is awesome and the halls were a lot of fun to explore. the room did not have air conditioning but had big windows and a fire-escape that we frequently hung out on. the bathroom was brand- new and very clean. the hotel is a home to a cat or two who were very friendly and nice to come back to see lying on the chair in the lobby.
reviews.title: best hotel i have ever stayed in!

reviews.text: the door had a pad-lock which scared me a little in the beginning but turned out to work as good as any ol' lock anyway. plus- the building is secure so no worries.
reviews.title: An Artistic Dream

likes.liked: — The art! What a marvelous place!

reviews.title: Give the Carlton a go!
reviews.text: the carlton arms is not an average holiday inn or ramada but it's a great price, has no roaches or any other creepy crawlies, is in a great location in midtown, close to the subway and great restaurants, and the only place i would like to stay if i go back to the city. if you're in for personality over unnecessary things like a tv (which you won't be watching anyway if you've got new york city outside your window) then stay here. if you're into luxury and need to be pampered, stick to the Ritz.

Just returned from my first stay at the Carlton Arms. I was thoroughly impressed. The staff are friendly, laidback, and very helpful. The rooms are clean, and every room and hall is beautifully decorated. The artists have done such a wonderful job. The website can't do the place justice! You even get your pick of which rooms are left when you arrive!
reviews.title: Not Quite What They Advertise!

likes.disliked: — that we chose to stay there!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is definitely not for those who insist that a hotel room should be plain and you MUST have your own porcelin throne. For the rest of us common folks (we are two well-paid professionals) the steep walk up the stairs at the end of the day, the shared showers and toilets are minor things to be part of the adventure of NYC. We stayed in roon 12B and I would definitely recommend this room. Not located by a street is a big plus. The A/C worked great and the sink was clean and worked well. If you want to see NYC, then stay here just for the sleeping (why would you spend any more time in your room than needed - this is New York!?!?!). A laid back staff and other people stayting there with the same "let's all get along" mentality was pretty neat. The two pubs right by the place were great to places to end the days/late nights, also.
reviews.title: This place is a geat value!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: this hotel is a good deal considering its location. the rooms look arty and interesting. however, we did not find the room very clean and there was a lot of noise from outside. wouldn't recommend this if you need some rest...
reviews.title: arty and central, but don't expect too much

reviews.text: Was in NYC for a semi-annual Broadway show marathon and thought I'd give Carlton Arms a try.
reviews.title: Loved it! Loved it!

reviews.text: Great place.
reviews.title: I LOVE the Carlton Arms!

reviews.text: Not fancy but very funky.
reviews.title: Saved Our WK-End Trip

likes.liked: — great price for location, safety was good

aka: Carlton Arms Hotel New York City
